A Guide to Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP)

Immigrate to Canada as a skilled worker, international student or entrepreneur through Alberta Advantage Immigration Program AAIP (formerly known as AINP).

Overview

The Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP), was formerly known as the Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP). It is based on opportunities to help boost the province’s economic growth by attracting work-ready individuals to the region. It is a top destination for immigration and offers a more affordable standard of living than in some provinces. Plus, with Calgary consistently in the top 10 of the best places to live, it’s a lifestyle that’s easy to adapt to.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Alberta Advantage Immigration Program Streams

We can divide the Alberta Advantage Immigration Program into the following categories:

1. AAIP Streams for Foreign Skilled Workers

The Alberta Advantage Immigration Program has three streams for foreign workers who are either living and working inside Alberta or planning to live and work there:[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Alberta Express Entry Stream”][vc_column_text]The Alberta Express Entry Stream is for those who are in the pool of Canada’s Express Entry system, including foreign skilled workers and international students. In this stream, the province of Alberta nominates qualified candidates from the national pool to submit an Invitation to Apply. These individuals have strong ties to Alberta and can help support the province’s economic development.

  • Express Entry Profile: You must have an active Express Entry Profile.
  • Occupation: Current occupation in your federal Express Entry profile should be an occupation that supports Alberta’s economic development and diversification.
  • Minimum CRS Score: you have to score a minimum Comprehensive Ranking System of 300.
  • Intention to live in Alberta: you must be interested in immigrating permanently to Alberta.
  • Additional Positive Factors:
    • a full-time job offer from a Canadian employer
    • a degree/diploma/certification from a Canadian institution
    • parents/siblings/relatives living in Alberta
    • French as your first language
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Rural Renewal Stream”][vc_column_text]The AAIP Rural Renewal Stream helps to recruit and retain immigrants to rural Alberta. It helps rural communities attract and retain foreign nationals who want to live, work, and settle. Individuals applying for the Rural Renewal Stream need to fulfil the following eligibility requirements:

  • Intention to live in Rural Communities: You must intend to live and work in your designated community in Alberta.
  • Community endorsement: You must obtain a valid Endorsement of the Candidate Letter from your designated rural community’s Economic Development Organization (EDO).
  • Job Offer: You must possess a full-time job offer or employment contract in a qualifying occupation in your specified community from an Alberta firm.
  • Occupation requirements: Occupations under NOC skill levels 0, A, B, C and D are eligible under the AAIP.
  • Work Experience: 12 months of full-time work experience in an eligible occupation within the last 18 months of filing your application.
  • Language requirements: CLB 5 or NCLC 5 If your job offer is for NOC 0, A or B. If your job offer is for NOC C or D occupation, then minimum CLB4 or NCLC 4.
  • Education: a degree, diploma or certificate. ECA is required if it is not obtained from Canadian Institution.
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Alberta Opportunity Stream”][vc_column_text]The Alberta Opportunity Stream is a pathway to Canadian permanent residence for foreign nationals working in the province and international graduates of an approved Alberta post-secondary school. The Alberta Opportunity Stream criteria may apply when you submit your application, when the AAIP evaluates your application or both. To ensure you meet the qualifying requirements, read the basic eligibility requirements carefully:

  • Residency: You must have valid temporary resident status in Canada.
  • Work Permit: You must have a valid temporary work permit. It can be an LMIA-based work permit, LMIA-exempt work permit, PGWP or an Open work permit.
  • Job Offer: All applicants, including PGWP holders, must have a full-time job offer from an Alberta employer to work in their present vocation in Alberta when their application is submitted and assessed by the AAIP.
  • Eligible Occupations: NOC skill levels 0, A, B, C and D are eligible under the AAIP.
  • Language Proficiency: If your job offer is of NOC 0, A or B occupation, then a minimum 5 level in each language skill in CLB (English) or NCLC test (French) is required. NOC C or D occupation must be level 4 in each language skill. NOC code 3413 requires a minimum score of CLB of 7 in each language skill.
  • Education: Educational Credential Assessment (ECA) for your highest level of education is required. ECA is not required if you have a Canadian degree, diploma or certificate, a valid Alberta Qualification Certificate, or a trade certificate.
  • Additional requirements for PGWP holders: Your degree/diploma/certificate must be issued by Alberta Advanced Education, a publicly funded post-secondary institution.
  • Work experience (within the last 18 months: You must possess a minimum of 12 months of work experience in your current occupation in Alberta. Also, 24 months of work experience (in Alberta plus Canada or outside Canada) is required. PGWP holders require only six months of work experience in a full-time job (30 hours a week).
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1669277723232{margin-top: 30px !important;}”]

2. Alberta Entrepreneurs Streams under AAIP

You can immigrate to Canada as an entrepreneur or a farmer through the Alberta Entrepreneur Immigration Streams. These are the four entrepreneurial immigration streams under AAIP:[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Graduate Entrepreneur Stream”][vc_column_text]The AAIP Graduate Entrepreneur Stream is for foreign graduates who have studied at Alberta Universities and Colleges and wish to start or purchase a business in the province.

  • Ownership: 34% or greater with Canadian citizens or permanent residents as partners.
  • Experience: Minimum 3 years as a business owner or four years in a senior management role.
  • Education: Completed a program lasting two or more years at an Alberta College or University. A degree or diploma is mandatory.
  • Language Proficiency: CLB 7 or above in English or French.
  • Work Permit: PGWP Mandatory.

Learn more: Alberta Graduate Entrepreneur Stream[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Foreign Graduate Entrepreneur Stream”][vc_column_text]The AAIP Foreign Graduate Entrepreneur Stream is for foreign graduates who want to launch start-up enterprises and innovative businesses in Alberta.

  • Minimum Investment: CAD 100,000 (Urban Center), CAD 50,000 (outside Calgary and Edmonton)
  • Ownership: 34% or higher (Urban Center), 51% (outside Calgary and Edmonton)
  • Experience: Min. 6 months as a business owner or manager.
  • Education: Equivalent college or university degree obtained from outside Canada.
  • Language Proficiency: CLB Level 5 or Above in English or French.
  • Pitch Deck: 10-minute slideshow presentation
  • Business Plan: Mandatory
  • Letter of Recommendation: Mandatory
  • Settlement Funds: Mandatory

Learn more: Alberta Foreign Graduate Entrepreneur Stream[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Farm Stream”][vc_column_text]The AAIP Farm Stream is for foreign entrepreneurs with the resources and experience to set up, purchase, and operate a farm in Alberta.

  • Minimum Net Worth: CAD 500,000
  • Minimum Investment: CAD 500,000
  • Farm Management Skills: Financial documents describing the current business, farm-related experience, training, and education.
  • Business Plan: Mandatory

Learn more: Alberta Self-Employed Farmer Stream[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”AAIP Rural Entrepreneur Stream”][vc_column_text]The AAIP Rural Entrepreneur Stream caters to foreign entrepreneurs and business people who wish to start or purchase a business in specific rural Alberta communities. This definition of “rural” refers to communities under 100,000.

  • Minimum Net Worth: CAD 300,000
  • Minimum Investment: CAD 200,000
  • Ownership: 51% or greater
  • Experience: Min. 3 years as a business owner or four years in a senior management role.
  • Education: Completed high school (ECA required)
  • Language Proficiency: CLB4 or Above in English or French.
  • Job Creation: Mandatory
  • Community Support Letter: Mandatory

Learn more: Alberta Rural Entrepreneur Stream[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1692821939743{margin-top: 30px !important;}”]

3. Alberta Accelerated Tech Pathway

The Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP) Accelerated Tech Pathway comes under the Alberta Express Entry Program. It provides faster processing to foreign workers currently working for or have a job offer with an Alberta-based tech employer in one of the eligible tech occupations.

These are the eligibility requirements for AAIP Accelerated Tech Pathway:

  • You must have an active Express Entry profile with a minimum Comprehensive Ranking System score of 300 in the federal Express Entry pool.
  • You must be employed full-time in Alberta or have a job offer for full-time employment in Alberta (full-time is a minimum of 30 hours per week) in one of the eligible Accelerated Tech Pathway occupations.
  • The principal occupation listed in your Express Entry profile corresponds to your current Alberta job or job offer.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

How ELAAR can help you?

Prospective immigrants who wish to immigrate to Alberta through any of the AAIP programs mentioned above should contact our experts. We have a team of exceptional Licensed Immigration Consultants who understand the AAIP requirements. They can assess your AAIP profile and optimize your application. Make your journey to Canada easier under the guidance of the experts at Elaar Immigration by contacting us today.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

FAQs: Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP)

These are some frequently asked questions about the Alberta Advantage Immigration Program.[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”What are the processing times for Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP)?”][vc_column_text]Under the AAIP programs, the processing time of each stream varies. Submissions submitted using the AIP web portal take 4 to 6 months on average, while paper applications take 15 to 19 months on average.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”How much is Alberta PNP application fee?”][vc_column_text]Applicants for the Alberta PNP must pay a $500 processing fee, which is non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application submission. This amount has nothing to do with whether or not the application receives a nomination.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Do I need job offer for AAIP?”][vc_column_text]Most of the AAIP Streams require a job offer except the Express Entry Pathway. To understand your options better, get in touch with ELAAR’s experienced immigration consultants.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Which documents are required for Alberta Express Entry program?”][vc_column_text]A list of all documents required for AAIP Streams. The requirements may vary with the stream you’re applying for. Get in touch with our experts to learn more.

  • Valid passports
  • Work permit(s)
  • Language assessment(s)
  • Educational Credential Assessment (ECA)
  • Education
  • AIT-recognized trade certificate
  • Licensing, registration, and certification (excluding trade certificates)
  • Alberta job offer(s) or employment contract
  • Employment reference letter(s)
  • Alberta relative(s) (if applicable)

Immigrate to Canada through AAIP

Move to Alberta province and obtain permanent residency through the AAIP.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default”
